td.p: Thomson, John. Journal, Mackenzie River, 1800-1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0021

div.p: Traded 14 skins of Dried Meat[,] 2 of Pounded[,] 5 of Grease & 2 of fatt – they really much surprised me, for I cannot imagine how they found it in their hearts to bring such a quantity of Provissions of their own accord to the Fort – it is the first time & I dare say the last we may expect the like[.] In the evening the hunters arrived[,] they brought only 11 Hares & all the Snares they say that they are Ruined in that quarter as the Wolves[,] Carcajous & foxes destroy all their Snares &c[.]

Saturday the 21st[.] The Indians arrived yesterday went away[,] gave them 3 sks of tobac on Credit[.] Sent the Hunters to set their Snares in another quarter[.] I was obliged to give one of them a Twist of the Snout for his impudence[.] Snowed a little and Blowed very hard all day[.]

Sunday the 22d[.] Early in the morning an Indian with his young wife arrived. [H]e is one of the y Men that left this the 23d of December & promised to back to hunt for the Fort[,] gave him a Dram & ps of Tobacco[,] he paid 18 skins of Credits[.] [H]e says that he would have made more skins but the wolves & carcajous Destroyed a great many[.] In the forenoon Martin St André & a young Man arrived Loaded with Dry Meat[,] gave them a Dram, they left behind in the Cache 2 Bales of Dried Cerasse which they say they were not able to bring[.] Traded 8 skins Dried Cerasse[,] 2 of fatt & 1 of Grease[.] There still remains to Trade belonging to others 10 skins of Dried Meat[,] 2 of Grease & 1 of fatt[.] Martin & St André say that the 3 Indians who came here the day before yesterday with Meat – were sent by them – for they had not the least intention of coming here had they not luckily early the 2d Morning that they left this espied their Fire at a Distance – they went to it & found eight voracious Slaves just arrived ready to Devour a Cache that contained Eight Bales of Meat[.] [T]hey say they were obliged to Quarrel & even Pillage them of the little Meat that they brought here[.] They are
